Synthetic Optimization Analysis SYNTHETIC

Based on synthetic dose margin modeling, the analysis identifies 8 customers with wide margins (>15% over-dose) that could save an estimated SAR 127,000/year through optimized dose targeting. These projections require actual dosimetry validation data for confirmation.

Savings Calculation Methodology

The synthetic savings estimate uses illustrative values to demonstrate what real analysis could reveal:

1.
Per-Customer Savings (SAR 5,000-50,000)

Based on dose margin reduction potential × annual processing volume × energy cost per kGy

2.
Annual Total (SAR 127,000)

8 customers with wide margins × average ~15,900 SAR annual savings each

Real Calculation Formula:

Annual Savings = Σ (Customers) × (Dose Reduction kGy) × (Energy Cost/kGy) × (Annual Jobs)

Data Required for Real Calculations:

  • Actual dosimetry readings (min/max/avg per job)
  • Energy consumption per kGy delivered
  • Product density and packing factors
  • Reprocessing rates and associated costs

OPTIMIZATION RECOMMENDATIONS
  • Review 6,220 SPSAs with wide dose margins
  • Tighten conveyor speed control for high-volume products
  • Implement real-time dose monitoring for continuous optimization

Dose Optimization Recommendations

Available with Current Data

  • • Identify SPSAs with wide dose margins for tightening
  • • Analyze customer dose requirements by product type
  • • Review packing configuration impact on dose delivery
  • • Compare accelerator efficiency for dose optimization

Data Collection Suggestions

  • • Actual dosimetry readings - to verify dose delivery accuracy
  • • Quality rejection data - to correlate dose margins with product quality
  • • Reprocessing records - to identify dose-related reprocessing costs
  • • Product density measurements - to optimize dose-depth calculations
